name: NPR
text:
The first lady Melania Trump says her and President Trump's 14-year-old son, Barron Trump, tested positive for the coronavirus, after initially testing negative, but "exhibited no symptoms."
https://t.co/9LpKzjVrcd

name: NPR
text: The CNN host says Americans in particular have some important decisions to make about the role of government in our lives. https://t.co/vIeW22pkHt

name: NPR
text:
A complete, original copy of Shakespeare's very first printed collection of plays was sold for nearly $10 million on Wednesday ‚Äî setting a world auction record for any printed work of literature.
https://t.co/p0G47eLxj5

name: NPR
text:
Twitter is blocking users from posting links to a New York Post story making unsubstantiated claims about Joe Biden and his son. Facebook also announced it would limit distribution of the story.
https://t.co/XaHZE5STjj

name: NPR
text:
Amy Coney Barrett said she would "keep an open mind" about the prospect of admitting TV cameras to the Supreme Court.
https://t.co/HfO6gtLtRv

name: NPR
text:
National security leaders are playing a much more prominent role this year than in previous elections. Current officials are stepping up to reassure voters.

And many former leaders are publicly taking a side for the first time‚Äîcriticizing President Trump.
https://t.co/pnYdgDvkd1

name: NPR
text:
Deng Je is the Wuhan-based founder of a female rap group called Bad Girls.

When the pandemic hit, she organized a volunteer group with three other women to coordinate donations and deliver supplies to hospitals.
https://t.co/pylGzl0FTx

name: NPR
text:
Drug overdose deaths rose roughly 10% in the first 3 months of this year, preliminary CDC data shows, offering the first official view of the pandemic's impact on Americans suffering addiction.
https://t.co/F597KpBNWa

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Cory Booker asked Amy Coney Barrett what she's read to educate herself on racism in the justice system. 

She said she's had conversations about it but "it's not something that I can say, yes I've done research on this and read X, Y and Z."
https://t.co/4rMTwMBWCq

name: NPR
text:
NEW: The Biden campaign says it raised $383 million in September along with the DNC and joint fundraising efforts ‚Äî a new record-breaking one-month sum, topping its August record of $364.5 million.
https://t.co/NtRMobgKby

name: NPR
text:
High levels of stress can have drastic effects on people's bodies.

Now at least 8 months into the pandemic, more and more Americans are reporting headaches, stomach problems, hair loss, autoimmune flare-ups, and other symptoms of chronic stress.
https://t.co/9GN9f0iDPK

name: NPR
text:
Russia's Vladimir Putin announced the approval of a new and yet-to-be-proven coronavirus vaccine developed by a former Soviet-era bioweapons lab. It hasn't completed large-scale human trials.
https://t.co/TUo6PbiK5k

name: NPR
text: Correction: Maki the lemur was reported missing on Wednesday morning. He was last seen at the San Francisco Zoo Tuesday night.

name: NPR
text:
More and more CEOs are now questioning how productive remote meetings are without in-person interaction.

In one survey, most workers admitted to "questionable behavior" during virtual meetings‚Äîincluding taking a shower, exercising, watching TV or cooking.
https://t.co/47hgUKw0w6

name: NPR
text:
Russia may send observers to monitor compliance of a cease-fire deal between Armenia and Azerbaijan in the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region amid mutual accusations over alleged truce violations.
https://t.co/gmziW4ih0f

name: NPR
text:
Only a handful of areas in the U.S. have the contact tracing workforce they need right now, a new analysis finds ‚Äî including Oregon, Vermont and D.C.

Maine, Montana, New York and Hawaii have enough when reserve staff are included.

44 states fall short.
https://t.co/3IlmsgUQkU

name: NPR
text:
8 out of 9 American workers don't have a union to represent them in workplace disputes.

One nonprofit website is helping employees push for better wages and working conditions during the pandemic ‚Äî and has seen more than 316,000 people join since March.
https://t.co/EXEnBLc8Qn

name: NPR
text:
Colombian singer Carlos Vives has been performing hits for almost 30 years. His latest album recently picked up 6 Latin Grammy nominations ‚Äî including Album of the Year.

Watch him perform at his Tiny Desk (home) concert ‚§µ
https://t.co/0QsqIMWvmo

name: NPR
text:
In 2016, support for Donald Trump surged in northeast Ohio. But after the closure of a GM assembly plant in 2019, some residents are changing their minds.
https://t.co/pvOx6985v9

name: NPR
text:
Overall deaths in the U.S. this year from COVID-19 and other causes are more than 85% higher than in nations like Germany and Israel after adjusting for population size, a new report finds.

"It's shocking. It's horrible."
https://t.co/fNtqcOTj4L

name: NPR
text:
Tommy Fisher decided he wanted to build his own private border wall in Texas, 

Engineers warn the structure will wash away in a flood; neighbors want it dismantled, and Fisher is embroiled in lawsuits. https://t.co/5e1cmRox4I

text:

name: NPR
text:
Amy Coney Barrett deflected answering most questions ‚Äî revealing little about her views on major legal issues like health care, abortion rights, voting rights or gun rights.

Here are some takeaways from her confirmation hearings:
https://t.co/JzE8GUwDxg

name: NPR
text:
The Biden campaign has canceled Kamala Harris' travel through Sunday after two people traveling with her tested positive for the coronavirus.

The campaign says Harris was not in close contact with either person and has tested negative twice this week.
https://t.co/FdRszD1jRl

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: This is Nienke Pastoor from the Netherlands. During the pandemic, she's been trying to help her four teenage kids with their online schoolwork and manage her 336-acre dairy farm. 

"Everyone expected me to successfully juggle everything," she said. https://t.co/8S6JTSr7XDThis is Nienke Pastoor from the Netherlands. During the pandemic, she's been trying to help her four teenage kids w‚Ä¶ https://t.co/kk9oJ2fEW1

text: RT @nprpolitics: Joe Biden's campaign announced that, along with the Democratic National Committee and joint fundraising efforts, it raised a record-breaking $383 million in September. https://t.co/I5rFB3xUwu

name: NPR
text:
London, Birmingham and other U.K. cities are now at a high alert for COVID-19, as officials tighten restrictions to fight the surging number of coronavirus cases.

"Things will get worse before they get better," U.K. Health Secretary Matt Hancock said.
https://t.co/NYtbtJPYzM

name: NPR
text:
RT @Roughly: Can evangelicals and environmentalists work together to confront global warming? 

We're going back to 2002, when it seemed the US conversation on climate change would lead to an unlikely alliance. üéß

https://t.co/uAV74AP1Hz

name: NPR
text:
The Senate Judiciary Committee is scheduled to vote on Amy Coney Barrett's Supreme Court nomination on Oct. 22 ‚Äî despite Democrats' attempts to delay proceedings.

Republicans are hoping the Senate will confirm Barrett before the Nov. 3 election.
 https://t.co/oXmcAmsmwg

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRGoatsandSoda: "When I was growing up, I marveled at how my single mother was able to come home after a long day of work, make dinner, and help me and my sister with our homework.

I can't imagine how she would have managed during this pandemic." -@malakagharib 

https://t.co/iHFENwm9yK

name: NPR
text:
The EU is hitting six Russian officials with sanctions over the suspected assassination attempt of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, citing the use of forbidden chemical weapons.
https://t.co/z9Q4NnMyVU

name: NPR
text:
NEW: With less than three weeks until Election Day, Joe Biden has opened up a double-digit lead over President Trump, the latest NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist poll finds.

It has Biden leading him 54% to 43% among likely voters.
https://t.co/VbwMIb0LRQ

name: NPR
text:
The United States Postal Service has settled a lawsuit in Montana that called on it to reverse its previously implemented service cutbacks in advance of Election Day next month.
https://t.co/VNQqj75GaN

name: NPR
text:
The Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee is launching a new seven-figure advertising investment aimed at mobilizing Black voters ‚Äî particularly Black men ‚Äî across nearly a dozen states.
https://t.co/ujPX772RWH
